articles.title: Quang Nguyen
articles.contents:
Biography



I am currently a graduate student at Loyola University Chicago, pursuing a Master of Science degree in Applied Statistics. I previously completed my undergraduate study at Wittenberg University in Springfield, Ohio, graduating in May 2020 with a Bachelor of Science degree in Mathematics and Data Science. I am originally from Nha Trang, Khanh Hoa, which is located in the South Central Coast of Vietnam (hence this is what the username qntkhvn represents). In my free time, you may find me watching sports, listening to podcasts, and cooking. I am a huge supporter of Manchester United F.C. of the English Premier League as well as NBA’s LA Clippers.
Education
   MS in Applied Statistics, 2021 (Expected)
        Loyola University Chicago
   BS in Mathematics and Data Science, 2020
        Wittenberg University
Interests
Statistics in sports
Data visualization
Using R and RStudio for data science
Contact
   nminhquang.99@gmail.com
   @qntkhvn
My old website: qntkhvn.github.io/quang

articles.title: News
articles.contents:
Spring 2022: I will be staying at Loyola University Chicago as an adjunct instructor in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics, before (hopefully) starting my PhD in the fall.
12/2021: I am expected to finish my MS in Applied Statistics at Loyola.
11/2021: I won the Reproducible Research Competition (Open Methods Track) at the 2021 Carnegie Mellon Sports Analytics Conferece (CMSAC) with my paper An Examination of Sport Climbing’s Competition Format and Scoring System
10/2021: I won the Best Student Poster Award at the 2021 UConn Sports Analytics Conferece (UCSAS) with my poster Concerns Regarding Sport Climbing Competition Format and Scoring System: Who’s Suffering?
10/2021: I took part in the 2021 Humana-Mays Healthcare Analytics Case Competition (organized by Texas A&M University). Our team finished 2/50 in the First Round Leaderboard, where the goal was to build a model for predicting vaccine hesitancy.
09/2021: I participated in a live coding session where I tried to predict the 2021 Brownlow Medal Winner for the Australian Football League (AFL). This was Rob Nguyen’s idea, where he wanted to pair up a stats person with no knowledge of Aussie rules with a journalist with domain expertise to see how well they can do at making predictions. Here are links to a video recording and an article on ABC News (Australia).
07/2021: I ranked first in the Kaggle leaderboard of SLICED (a data science show) as an audience partipicant. The competition topic was predicting baseball home runs.
